CAD Formats.Key Features: CAD drawings, vector data, and metadata.
CAD Formats.Interoperability: High (standard for AutoCAD and compatible tools).
Medium (used for publishing and viewing CAD data).

CAD Formats.Key Features: 3D CAD models with geometry and metadata.

3D Printing Formats.Key Features: Simple geometry, no color or material support.
3D Printing Formats.Compression: None (ASCII is larger; Binary is compact).
3D Printing Formats.Interoperability: High (universally supported by 3D printers and software).

3D Printing Formats.Key Features: Modern, supports color, materials, and metadata.
3D Printing Formats.Interoperability: High (growing adoption, supported by modern 3D printers and software).
Medium (better than STL but not universally supported).
High (widely supported, optimized for web and modern tools).

3D Printing Formats.Key Features: Binary version of glTF for compact storage.
3D Printing Formats.Interoperability: High (ideal for efficient loading and transmission, especially on web platforms).

3D Printing Formats.Compression: None (large file size, especially with textures).
3D Printing Formats.Interoperability: High (widely supported, but companion `.mtl` files needed for materials).
High (used for interoperability between 3D modeling software).

Image Formats.Interoperability: High (standard for web, photography, and general use).
High (widely supported, ideal for web and transparency).

Image Formats.Key Features: Animated or static images with 256 colors max.
Image Formats.Interoperability: High (used for simple animations and low-color images).

Image Formats.Compression: None (XML-based, can be compressed via gzip).
Image Formats.Interoperability: High (ideal for web and scalable graphics).

Image Formats.Key Features: Modern format with lossy and lossless modes.
Image Formats.Interoperability: High (optimized for web use, supported in modern browsers).
Medium (used in professional photography and printing).

Document Formats.Key Features: Portable Document Format for text and graphics.
